item.title: Enchantment in the history of science, literature, and art
item.description: This event will be held on Zoom - please register on Eventbrite to attend Speakers Professor David Morgan, Duke University Professor Carrie Tirado Bramen, University at Buffalo Readings David Morgan, “Enchantment and Disenchantment” in Images at Work: The Material Culture of Enchantment (OUP, 2019). Christine Smallwood, “Astrology in the Age of Uncertainty” in The New Yorker, 28 October 2019. Nicholas Campion, “Introduction: Origins and Background” in A History of Western Astrology Volume II: The Medieval and Modern Worlds (Bloomsbury, 2009)

item.title: Enchantment in theology and scholarship on magic
item.description: Speakers Professor Owen Davies, University of Hertfordshire Professor Jason Ānanda Josephson Storm, Williams College Readings Owen Davies, ‘Cunning-Folk in the Medical Market-Place during the Nineteenth Century’. Medical History 43, no. 1 (1999): 55–73. Owen Davies, “Chapter 7: Pulp magic” in Grimoires: A History of Magic Books (Oxford, 2009). Jason Ānanda Josephson Storm, “Max Weber and the Rationalization of Magic,” Yelle and Trein eds., in Narratives of Disenchantment and Secularization (Bloomsbury, 2020), pp.
